summary: Kermit L. Hall was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents mention him in the context of his role on the ARRB, which was responsible for reviewing and declassifying records related to the JFK assassination. As a board member, Hall was involved in decisions regarding the release of CIA information, the declassification of military records related to U.S. policy toward Cuba, and requests for additional information from the CIA. The documents also highlight the security clearances required for ARRB members and the coordination between the ARRB and various government agencies like the CIA and FBI. Hall's biography is included in a document providing background information on all ARRB members.
